name: 3.1 - Inspection of Switchboard Cabinet Pieces prior to delivery to site
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check overall condition. check connections for internal electrical components
Acceptance Criteria - Visual check and report any defects or areas of concern
Verifying Document - Email or NTE to report
3.2 - Delivery of Switchboard materials to site
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check and verify that the switchboard materials have been delivered damage free
Acceptance Criteria - materials are damage free
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pre-Removal of required covers from Switchboard
Acceptance Criteria - isolation of switchboard is proven
Verifying Document - on site testing, isolation tags in place
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Switchboard exterior panels removed as required
Acceptance Criteria - work area secured, all voltage sources isolated. no signs of degradation on switchboard.
Verifying Document - Testing, photos as required
4.3 - Connection of new Generator Change-over cabinet.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - connections of electrical cabling/bus bars.
Acceptance Criteria - Cabling/busbars connected correctly, insulation resistance between conductors acceptable.
Verifying Document - Switchboard Acceptance Test. C.O.C from Switchboard Manufacturers.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Switchboard work completed.
Acceptance Criteria - Switchboard upgrades completed. testing completed, interlocks between main switch and generator switch tested and verified, phase rotation confirmed
Verifying Document - Switchboard C.O.C, instrument test of supply mains.
4.5 - Submission/review/appr oval of the Level 2 FD
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Software functionality meets expectations
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Assembled, inspection carried out and approved
Acceptance Criteria - Electrical Testing completed, all covers in place and secured.
Verifying Document - Switchboard acceptance test sheet.
3.1 - Inspection of VSD prior to delivery to site
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check overall condition of packaging, noting any obvious signs of damage, Check rating of drives is correct.
Acceptance Criteria - Visual check and report any defects or areas of concern
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check and verify that correct VSD are delivered and that drives are undamaged
Acceptance Criteria - VSD are damage free
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - materials for frame delivered to site
Acceptance Criteria - Correct materials on site, protective coatings correct.
Verifying Document - Delivery Docket for Materials
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Frame Built and bolted to Ground.
Acceptance Criteria - Frame built and Securely attached to ground, minimal flex/ movement when force applied.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - VSD Mounted to frame
Acceptance Criteria - VSD Mounted satisfactorily, bolts tight, washers and spring washers present, S/S bolts and fixings used.
4.4 - Installation of supply cables to VSD
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Cables installed, not terminated into VSDs or switchboard
Acceptance Criteria - Correct Cables installed, suitable for full load plus 20 percent of VSD, insulation resistance acceptable
Verifying Document - VSD Cable Test Sheets.
4.5 - Installation of Output Cables From VSD to Motors
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Cables installed, not terminated at motors or VSD
Acceptance Criteria - Correct Cables installed, suitable for full load of motor plus 20 percent, insulation resistance acceptable
Verifying Document - VSD Cable Test Sheets.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Cables terminated into VSD
Acceptance Criteria - Correct Cables installed, terminals tightened to correct torque, cables prepared correctly. cable earths and screens fit off correctly.
Verifying Document - VSD Cable Test Sheets.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Cables fit off at Switchboard.
Acceptance Criteria - Correct Cables installed, terminals tightened to correct torque, cables prepared correctly. cable earths and screens fit off correctly.
Verifying Document - VSD Cable Test Sheets.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Cables installed, not terminated into motor
Acceptance Criteria - Correct motors installed. insulation resistance verified, winding configuration confirmed against nameplate.
Verifying Document - VSD Cable Test Sheets.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Cables fit off at Motor
Acceptance Criteria - Cables Lugged off correctly, terminals tightened to correct torque
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - VSD Energised and set up, motor nameplate data entered, protections set, Labels attached
Acceptance Criteria - VSD parameters set correctly, inputs set up as per drawings. analog i/o set correctly and verified to plc
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Assembled and in position, inspection carried out and approved
Acceptance Criteria - Motors Tested, rotation direction confirmed, pumps operating as intended.

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Cables terminated into VSD
Acceptance Criteria - Correct Cables installed, terminals tightened to correct torque, cables prepared correctly. cable earths and screens fit off correctly.

Acceptance Criteria - VSD parameters set correctly, inputs set up as per drawings. analog i/o set correctly and verified to plc

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Assembled and in position, inspection carried out and approved
Acceptance Criteria - Motors Tested, rotation direction confirmed, pumps operating as intended.

Acceptance Criteria - Compatable with the drill unit

Acceptance Criteria - Quantities correct. Dimensions correct.

4.1 - Mark out penetration on both sides (wet & dry sides) using existing pipe as reference
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check and verify dimensains against drawings
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Document + Visual + Photograph + Engineer site Inspection
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Monitor work and progress report any issues
Acceptance Criteria - Approval to proceed from item 4.1

Acceptance Criteria - Dimensioin & Surface check. As per Drawing M0003 and notes.

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check measurents and vereify correct fitment
Acceptance Criteria - As detailed on Drawings & specifications
4.5 - Installation of Reinforcing bar, starters & trimmers
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Drill holes around perimeter to receive reinforcing bar. Check for correct diameter & corret embedment
Acceptance Criteria - As detailed on Drawings

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check that orientation is correct and is in alignment with pump assembly
Acceptance Criteria - As detailed on Drawings M0003 and drawing notes
Verifying Document - Drawing M0001 Drawing M0002 Drawing M0003 Drawing M0004

Acceptance Criteria - As detailed on Drawings and completion of item 4.7

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check & Verify that correct Mounting plate is delivered
Acceptance Criteria - Mounting plate is dumensionally correct and is damage free

Acceptance Criteria - Ensure all fasteners are tight and toqued to manufacturers specifications
Verifying Document - KSB documentation & Installation Instructiions
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Correct Mounting plate position on plinth, correct use of fasteners and torque requirements, in accordance with KSB installation instruction
Acceptance Criteria - Position is determined by the fixed pipework. Ensure alignment of flange face is parallel to wet well wall
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Motor/Pump shaft alignment
Acceptance Criteria - Motor and shaft aligment as best as possible
Verifying Document - KSB documentation & Installation Instructiions. Nothing final alignment to be undertaken by a Technician - Ref: 561482-ITP-005.2

561482-ITP-009.2 - Pre Commissioning Testing Pump & Valves - Pump 2
template name: 561482-ITP-009.2 - Pre Commissioning Testing Pump & Valves - Pump 2

name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pressure testing between suction and discharge isolation valves
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Remove Entrained air
Acceptance Criteria - Bleed until water visible
4.2 - Visual Check over of Pump 2 and motor
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Look for any visible leaking
Acceptance Criteria - All pipework connections tight All Cable & Terminations secure
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check for correct pump rotation direction
Acceptance Criteria - Rotation direction is correct
Verifying Document - Pump build sheet literature
4.4 - Pressure testing between suction and diacharge isolation valves - Pump 2
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - VSD Energised, water in pump pipelines
Acceptance Criteria - No visible leaking as per Item 4.2
Verifying Document - To meet Specification requirements and not to exceed pump manufacturers maximum pressure (Pump flanges 16Bar, Seal max pressure 30Bar)
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pump rotation direction as per manufacturers technical information
Acceptance Criteria - Pump rotation direction is correct and matched the technical information
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Record on ITP
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Record Gauge pressure
Acceptance Criteria - Pass - no pressure loss or visible weaping
Verifying Document - This ITP & Specified Pressure testing document
